titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide civil service retirement credit to a Federal employee for any period of service performed with the American Red Cross abroad during a period of war.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Compensation and Employee Benefits.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 9/9/1993--Introduced. Provides civil service retirement credit to a Federal employee who leaves his or her position to serve with the American Red Cross abroad during a period of war if such employee subsequently returns to Federal employment.
